issue.title: It seems like unavailable covers are not being detected, e.g. cover.living_room_blinds
issue.body:
I have an automation that contains:

```
      - service: cover.close_cover
        data: {}
        target:
          entity_id: cover.living_room_blinds
```

Something went wrong with my blinds, and they are all unavailable now, but not showing up in the watchman report. Would it be possible to check for `cover.*`? Thanks!

issue.title: Is this library dead?
issue.body: Based on the state of issues/PRs/releases it seems like this project has been abandoned; which would be disappointing but I understand that life and priorities change. Would be great however if the README/documentation was updated to indicate this - or better - if it was handed over to someone/community to take over (maybe @Adam21e would volunteer and merge back in from their fork?). Personally, I invested time implementing a project using this library (due to handy `summarize` method) only to find later that it, as well as other functionality like `last` and `subnet`, are not defined for IPv6 addresses.

comment.body:
This was driving me crazy, I couldn't figure out why I was getting this error:

```
NoMethodError: undefined method `link_local?' for #<IPAddress::IPv4:0x00007faef0051dc8>
```

I didn't realize the version on Rubygems is so old. A new release would be greatly appreciated. For now I'll point directly to the GitHub repo

issue.title: Split full name into first and last name
issue.body:
In addition to capitilizing full names correctly, would it be possible to add some logic to split names into first and last?

I'm currently using this there are probably some exceptions that should be handled:

```
  def first_name
    return '' unless name?
    name_parts = CapitalizeNames.capitalize(name.strip).split(' ')
    return name.titleize if name_parts.count == 1
    name_parts[0..-2].map(&:titleize).join(' ')
  end

  def last_name
    return '' unless name?
    name_parts = CapitalizeNames.capitalize(name.strip).split(' ')
    return '' if name_parts.count == 1
    name_parts.last.titleize
  end
```

pull_request.title: Pass env to check blocks or #call methods
pull_request.body:
I want to set up a healthbit check to ensure that the client IP is getting forwarded correctly through load balancers and nginx, so that `request.remote_ip` is not a private IP. I needed access to the rack env in order to check the headers.

This change is backwards compatible: It only passes env if the block or method accepts an argument

issue.title: Actions not working for paranoid items
issue.body:
I'm using the [paranoia gem](https://github.com/rubysherpas/paranoia) with makes my selected models act as paranoid and grants me the `with_deleted` scope so I can search for deleted items. 

I've added `scope :with_deleted, default: true` to my admin model and on the index page it works fine, listing all the deleted objects, yet when I try to execute an action I do get not found error. Looking at the output in the console it is in fact not using the default scope I have specified and is searching only on non-deleted objects. 

How can I make actions work with paranoid models?

comment.body: In case anyone else finds this issue, you should check out the active_admin_paranoia gem, which handles all of these behaviors: https://github.com/raihan2006i/active_admin_paranoia

issue.title: Any suggestions for keeping track of a large number of 1/4W resistors from a resistor pack?
issue.body:
I've bought a few packs of through-hole 1/4W resistors for breadboards prototypes, with the full E24 range. (eg. 1.8K, 2.0K, 2.2K)
I would like to keep track of these so I know if I'm getting low on 330 Ohm, 1K, etc.

There's a large number of different values and lots of different DigiKey products to import, so I definitely want to find a way to automate this and do a big batch import. For example, [all of the results for this query](https://www.digikey.co.nz/en/products/filter/through-hole-resistors/53?s=N4IgjCBcoExaBjKAzAhgGwM4FMA0IB7KAbXADYBWAFgGYQBdfABwBcoQBlFgJwEsA7AOYgAvvjrQQSSGix5CJEDAoAGOoxCt2XPkNH4wAdirwpKDDnxFIpGjEp2GzNpE48BwsSAC0ESdNlLBRsQKioATgh6ES84EO5sTF5MFgJuEHwAJQApABUAIScQClMmKDBmMshlLzJTXgATdhgVAA4S53YAVX5eFgB5ZABZbFRMAFcEjJAWAE8mbHYxpBigA).

e.g.

* 10: https://www.digikey.co.nz/en/products/detail/lumimax-optoelectronic-technology/CF1-4W10RJTB/16710451
* 180: https://www.digikey.co.nz/en/products/detail/lumimax-optoelectronic-technology/CF1-4W180RJTB/16708329
* 270: https://www.digikey.co.nz/en/products/detail/lumimax-optoelectronic-technology/CF1-4W270RJTB/16708376
* 1K: https://www.digikey.co.nz/en/products/detail/lumimax-optoelectronic-technology/CF1-4W1KJTB/16708299
* 2K: https://www.digikey.co.nz/en/products/detail/lumimax-optoelectronic-technology/CF1-4W2K7JTB/16708187

Do you have any suggestions for how to automate this? Is there an example script I can use to generate [CSV or XLSX that can be imported into InvenTree](https://inventree.readthedocs.io/en/stable/settings/import/)?

issue.title: Automatically add "part stock" quantities to InvenTree when importing parts
issue.body:
Thanks for building this awesome tool! I was just wondering if there is a way to automatically add part stock as well? I'm trying to import lots of electronic components in my workshop, and it's a bit tedious that I have to create new stock items for every part. It would be useful if there was another field where I could choose the number of parts that I have and the stock location, and it creates the part stock entries with all these fields filled out: Supplier Part, Stock Location, and Quantity.

Is there already an option for this? If not, would you accept a PR?

issue.title: [FR] Is there a default library of electronic categories and parts that I could import?

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: This is an suggested enhancement or new feature

labels.name: triage:not-checked
labels.description: Item was not checked by the core team

issue.body:
### Please verify that this feature request has NOT been suggested before.

- [X] I checked and didn't find similar feature request

### Problem statement

I've just started trying out InvenTree to organize my home workshop and keep track of all my electronic components. I saw that InvenTree is installed as a blank slate and doesn't come with any options for predefined categories or parts. (As far as I'm aware.) This means that it will be quite tedious to set up lots of common categories for my electronic components.

I found the feature request issue for supplier integrations, and this sounds very interesting: https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/issues/3261

I'm in New Zealand, and I would be very interested in integrations with the following suppliers:

* Mouser electronics
* RS Components
* Element14
* Digi-Key
* Jaycar electronics
* Surplustronics
* Adafruit
* Sparkfun

In the meantime, it would be really helpful if I could import some basic categories for electronic components (e.g. resistors, LEDs, relays, switches.) Maybe also some common parts that can be ordered from any supplier (resistors, transisitors, diodes, push button switches, etc.) I don't want to start from scratch and add all these myself if someone already has a database that they could share.

### Suggested solution

Are there any database dumps that I could import, so that I could start with a basic list of categoriess and parts?

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Manually enter everything myself

### Examples of other systems

Not sure

### Do you want to develop this?

- [ ] I want to develop this.

comment.body: I found the [Ki-nTree integration](https://github.com/sparkmicro/Ki-nTree/). This provides [a really handy script that can set up lots of default categories](https://github.com/sparkmicro/Ki-nTree/#before-starting): `python3 -m kintree.setup_inventree`. That's awesome! I think it would be really useful if there was an option to use this default list of sub-categories when installing InvenTree, because it took me a little while to figure this out. I also got the Digikey API integration working, so I can import part numbers via their API: I'm really loving this software so far! Thanks to all the developers!

issue.title: Feature request: find/add parts using the octopart api
issue.body:
Hi,

I found this neat project on the Kicad forum and tried it instantly.
What holds me back from using it in a medium sized company is the part entry stuff.
It is a lot of manual work (even with the batch import/edit) and errors can be made. Also the price information can be old.

Octopart has a nice API: https://octopart.com/api/home
Adding a part would be much easier as all the information (including prices from multiple distributors, a picture and possibly Kicad library parts) can be fetched automatically. I'm starting to dream now but perhaps email notifications can be sent when stocks at distributors get low for instance.

comment.body:
If anyone else finds this comment - https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/issues/541#issuecomment-677961649

Here's the new link for the third-party InvenTree integrations page in the docs: https://inventree.readthedocs.io/en/latest/extend/plugins/

issue.title: [FR] Supplier integration

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: This is an suggested enhancement or new feature

labels.name: roadmap
labels.description: This is a roadmap feature with no immediate plans for implementation

issue.body:
**Problem**
There are a bunch of integrations for different vendors. Most implement the same logic.

**Suggested solution**
Create models and APIs to make integration easy. Create them in a way that TOSs are not borken.
- [x] Model + API for API keys and connections settings
- [ ] Model + API for requests + answers (+ cleanup)
- [x] Plugin mixin to enable easy search integration
- [ ] API + python integration to enable third parties proxied calls without keys on the system (or knowledge of them at all).

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
A lot of small implementations work right now.

**Do you want to develop this?**
Yes - I have some code that will be seriously reduced by that.


I really would like to get some feedback on this and maybe make a list of all vendors that should be considered:
- [ ] DigiKey
- [ ] Mouser
- [ ] SnapEDA #566
- [ ] OcotPartAPI #541
- [ ] LSCS https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/issues/677#issuecomment-612674739

comment.body:
Thanks for all your work on this @matmair, the supplier integration PR looks very exciting.

I was just wondering if this new feature will also be able to import part categories from suppliers? I opened a new issue since I wanted to see if there is a list of predefined categories and electronic components that I could start with, instead of starting with an empty database: https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/issues/3842

If anyone has been using InvenTree for a while, would you be willing to share a database backup that includes part categories? Thanks a lot!

issue.title: Add "send test email" feature for self-hosted installations
issue.body:
## Prerequisites
- [x] I have searched open and closed issues to make sure that the feature has not yet been requested.

## Feature request
Email reports on my self-hosted Plausible instance don't seem to be working, and I'm having some trouble debugging it: I can't find any Oban jobs from the `Plausible.Workers.SendEmailReports` module, and the functions that actually send the email are private in the workers. It'd be nice if there was some way to send a test email and display potential errors.

**How would you like it to work**
A button in the settings would let you send a test email to yourself (if your address has been verified). If any errors occur, they can be displayed in the front-end.

Alternatively, there could be a way to send such an email from the IEX console.

comment.body: Sorry to comment on an old thread, but I was also having email issues. Are the scheduled email reports still disabled by default? It looks like `CRON_ENABLED` is still set to `false` by default. I've used the password reset feature to confirm that emails are working (with Postmark), and I've just set `CRON_ENABLED=true`, so hopefully will see some email reports soon.

issue.title: Spelling mistake in the project name - Should be "ESPresence"
issue.body: Apologies if this has been brought up before, but I searched through the GitHub issues and didn't find anything for "typo" or "spelling". It's been bugging me for a little while that there's a spelling mistake in the project name. As far as I'm aware, I don't think "presense" is a valid spelling of the word "presence". #### https://wikidiff.com/presence/presense ---------- You can see how many times people have spelled it as "espresence" in the GitHub issues: https://github.com/ESPresense/ESPresense/issues?page=1&q=espresence ---------- Another point - lots of results for "presence" in the Home Assistant Core codebase: Zero results for "presense": So this can cause some confusion when setting up configuration for Home Assistant and MQTT. -------- `espresence.com` is unavailable, but I'd be happy to pay for `espresence.io` or `espresence.org`, or some other TLD. Perhaps this could be done for a version 3 major release. Please feel free to close this issue if you feel that it's too late to change the name or if it will be too much work. I just thought it needed to be opened!

issue.title: Split full name into first and last name
issue.body:
In addition to capitilizing full names correctly, would it be possible to add some logic to split names into first and last?

I'm currently using this there are probably some exceptions that should be handled:

```
  def first_name
    return '' unless name?
    name_parts = CapitalizeNames.capitalize(name.strip).split(' ')
    return name.titleize if name_parts.count == 1
    name_parts[0..-2].map(&:titleize).join(' ')
  end

  def last_name
    return '' unless name?
    name_parts = CapitalizeNames.capitalize(name.strip).split(' ')
    return '' if name_parts.count == 1
    name_parts.last.titleize
  end
```

I would like to keep track of these so I know if I'm getting low on 330 Ohm, 1K, etc.

There's a large number of different values and lots of different DigiKey products to import, so I definitely want to find a way to automate this and do a big batch import. For example, [all of the results for this query](https://www.digikey.co.nz/en/products/filter/through-hole-resistors/53?s=N4IgjCBcoExaBjKAzAhgGwM4FMA0IB7KAbXADYBWAFgGYQBdfABwBcoQBlFgJwEsA7AOYgAvvjrQQSSGix5CJEDAoAGOoxCt2XPkNH4wAdirwpKDDnxFIpGjEp2GzNpE48BwsSAC0ESdNlLBRsQKioATgh6ES84EO5sTF5MFgJuEHwAJQApABUAIScQClMmKDBmMshlLzJTXgATdhgVAA4S53YAVX5eFgB5ZABZbFRMAFcEjJAWAE8mbHYxpBigA).

e.g.

* 180: https://www.digikey.co.nz/en/products/detail/lumimax-optoelectronic-technology/CF1-4W180RJTB/16708329

issue.title: [FR] Is there a default library of electronic categories and parts that I could import?

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: This is an suggested enhancement or new feature

labels.name: triage:not-checked
labels.description: Item was not checked by the core team

issue.body:
### Please verify that this feature request has NOT been suggested before.

- [X] I checked and didn't find similar feature request

### Problem statement

I've just started trying out InvenTree to organize my home workshop and keep track of all my electronic components. I saw that InvenTree is installed as a blank slate and doesn't come with any options for predefined categories or parts. (As far as I'm aware.) This means that it will be quite tedious to set up lots of common categories for my electronic components.

I found the feature request issue for supplier integrations, and this sounds very interesting: https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/issues/3261

I'm in New Zealand, and I would be very interested in integrations with the following suppliers:

* Mouser electronics
* RS Components
* Element14
* Digi-Key
* Jaycar electronics
* Surplustronics
* Adafruit
* Sparkfun

In the meantime, it would be really helpful if I could import some basic categories for electronic components (e.g. resistors, LEDs, relays, switches.) Maybe also some common parts that can be ordered from any supplier (resistors, transisitors, diodes, push button switches, etc.) I don't want to start from scratch and add all these myself if someone already has a database that they could share.

### Suggested solution

Are there any database dumps that I could import, so that I could start with a basic list of categoriess and parts?

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Manually enter everything myself

### Examples of other systems

Not sure

### Do you want to develop this?

- [ ] I want to develop this.

comment.body: I found the [Ki-nTree integration](https://github.com/sparkmicro/Ki-nTree/). This provides [a really handy script that can set up lots of default categories](https://github.com/sparkmicro/Ki-nTree/#before-starting): `python3 -m kintree.setup_inventree`. That's awesome! I think it would be really useful if there was an option to use this default list of sub-categories when installing InvenTree, because it took me a little while to figure this out. I also got the Digikey API integration working, so I can import part numbers via their API: I'm really loving this software so far! Thanks to all the developers!

issue.title: Feature request: find/add parts using the octopart api
issue.body:
Hi,

I found this neat project on the Kicad forum and tried it instantly.
What holds me back from using it in a medium sized company is the part entry stuff.
It is a lot of manual work (even with the batch import/edit) and errors can be made. Also the price information can be old.

Octopart has a nice API: https://octopart.com/api/home
Adding a part would be much easier as all the information (including prices from multiple distributors, a picture and possibly Kicad library parts) can be fetched automatically. I'm starting to dream now but perhaps email notifications can be sent when stocks at distributors get low for instance.

comment.body:
If anyone else finds this comment - https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/issues/541#issuecomment-677961649

Here's the new link for the third-party InvenTree integrations page in the docs: https://inventree.readthedocs.io/en/latest/extend/plugins/

issue.title: [FR] Supplier integration

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: This is an suggested enhancement or new feature

labels.name: roadmap
labels.description: This is a roadmap feature with no immediate plans for implementation

issue.body:
**Problem**
There are a bunch of integrations for different vendors. Most implement the same logic.

**Suggested solution**
Create models and APIs to make integration easy. Create them in a way that TOSs are not borken.
- [x] Model + API for API keys and connections settings
- [ ] Model + API for requests + answers (+ cleanup)
- [x] Plugin mixin to enable easy search integration
- [ ] API + python integration to enable third parties proxied calls without keys on the system (or knowledge of them at all).

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
A lot of small implementations work right now.

**Do you want to develop this?**
Yes - I have some code that will be seriously reduced by that.


I really would like to get some feedback on this and maybe make a list of all vendors that should be considered:
- [ ] DigiKey
- [ ] Mouser
- [ ] SnapEDA #566
- [ ] OcotPartAPI #541
- [ ] LSCS https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/issues/677#issuecomment-612674739

comment.body:
Thanks for all your work on this @matmair, the supplier integration PR looks very exciting.

I was just wondering if this new feature will also be able to import part categories from suppliers? I opened a new issue since I wanted to see if there is a list of predefined categories and electronic components that I could start with, instead of starting with an empty database: https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/issues/3842

If anyone has been using InvenTree for a while, would you be willing to share a database backup that includes part categories? Thanks a lot!

issue.title: Add "send test email" feature for self-hosted installations
issue.body:
## Prerequisites
- [x] I have searched open and closed issues to make sure that the feature has not yet been requested.

## Feature request
Email reports on my self-hosted Plausible instance don't seem to be working, and I'm having some trouble debugging it: I can't find any Oban jobs from the `Plausible.Workers.SendEmailReports` module, and the functions that actually send the email are private in the workers. It'd be nice if there was some way to send a test email and display potential errors.

**How would you like it to work**
A button in the settings would let you send a test email to yourself (if your address has been verified). If any errors occur, they can be displayed in the front-end.

Alternatively, there could be a way to send such an email from the IEX console.

comment.body: Sorry to comment on an old thread, but I was also having email issues. Are the scheduled email reports still disabled by default? It looks like `CRON_ENABLED` is still set to `false` by default. I've used the password reset feature to confirm that emails are working (with Postmark), and I've just set `CRON_ENABLED=true`, so hopefully will see some email reports soon.

issue.title: Spelling mistake in the project name - Should be "ESPresence"
issue.body: Apologies if this has been brought up before, but I searched through the GitHub issues and didn't find anything for "typo" or "spelling". It's been bugging me for a little while that there's a spelling mistake in the project name. As far as I'm aware, I don't think "presense" is a valid spelling of the word "presence". #### https://wikidiff.com/presence/presense ---------- You can see how many times people have spelled it as "espresence" in the GitHub issues: https://github.com/ESPresense/ESPresense/issues?page=1&q=espresence ---------- Another point - lots of results for "presence" in the Home Assistant Core codebase: Zero results for "presense": So this can cause some confusion when setting up configuration for Home Assistant and MQTT. -------- `espresence.com` is unavailable, but I'd be happy to pay for `espresence.io` or `espresence.org`, or some other TLD. Perhaps this could be done for a version 3 major release. Please feel free to close this issue if you feel that it's too late to change the name or if it will be too much work. I just thought it needed to be opened!

issue.title: Split full name into first and last name
issue.body:
In addition to capitilizing full names correctly, would it be possible to add some logic to split names into first and last?

I'm currently using this there are probably some exceptions that should be handled:

```
  def first_name
    return '' unless name?
    name_parts = CapitalizeNames.capitalize(name.strip).split(' ')
    return name.titleize if name_parts.count == 1
    name_parts[0..-2].map(&:titleize).join(' ')
  end

  def last_name
    return '' unless name?
    name_parts = CapitalizeNames.capitalize(name.strip).split(' ')
    return '' if name_parts.count == 1
    name_parts.last.titleize
  end
```

pull_request.title: Pass env to check blocks or #call methods
pull_request.body:
I want to set up a healthbit check to ensure that the client IP is getting forwarded correctly through load balancers and nginx, so that `request.remote_ip` is not a private IP. I needed access to the rack env in order to check the headers.

This change is backwards compatible: It only passes env if the block or method accepts an argument

issue.title: I will be maintaining a fork: https://github.com/DocSpring/active_admin_paranoia
issue.body:
I've been using activeadmin and paranoia for a long time and I just discovered this active_admin_paranoia gem. 

I've cherry-picking all of the open PRs into my fork: https://github.com/DocSpring/active_admin_paranoia
I have a test suite with a high level of test coverage (including all my admin pages and features), so I will be maintaining my fork and fixing any issues when Rails or activeadmin is updated. Please feel free to use my fork:

```
gem 'active_admin_paranoia', github: 'DocSpring/active_admin_paranoia', branch: :master
```

---

@raihan2006i I'd also be happy to help maintain this repo and merge PRs / push new versions to Rubygems if you would like some help. Thanks for the gem!

comment.body: @raihan2006i Thanks I have access to the GitHub repo, but I don't have access to https://rubygems.org/gems/active_admin_paranoia yet. I don't see anything in my rubygems account and didn't receive any emails. Could you please try again? Thanks!

issue.title: Actions not working for paranoid items
issue.body:
I'm using the [paranoia gem](https://github.com/rubysherpas/paranoia) with makes my selected models act as paranoid and grants me the `with_deleted` scope so I can search for deleted items. 

I've added `scope :with_deleted, default: true` to my admin model and on the index page it works fine, listing all the deleted objects, yet when I try to execute an action I do get not found error. Looking at the output in the console it is in fact not using the default scope I have specified and is searching only on non-deleted objects. 

How can I make actions work with paranoid models?

comment.body: In case anyone else finds this issue, you should check out the active_admin_paranoia gem, which handles all of these behaviors: https://github.com/raihan2006i/active_admin_paranoia

issue.title: Any suggestions for keeping track of a large number of 1/4W resistors from a resistor pack?
issue.body:
I've bought a few packs of through-hole 1/4W resistors for breadboards prototypes, with the full E24 range. (eg. 1.8K, 2.0K, 2.2K)
I would like to keep track of these so I know if I'm getting low on 330 Ohm, 1K, etc.

There's a large number of different values and lots of different DigiKey products to import, so I definitely want to find a way to automate this and do a big batch import. For example, [all of the results for this query](https://www.digikey.co.nz/en/products/filter/through-hole-resistors/53?s=N4IgjCBcoExaBjKAzAhgGwM4FMA0IB7KAbXADYBWAFgGYQBdfABwBcoQBlFgJwEsA7AOYgAvvjrQQSSGix5CJEDAoAGOoxCt2XPkNH4wAdirwpKDDnxFIpGjEp2GzNpE48BwsSAC0ESdNlLBRsQKioATgh6ES84EO5sTF5MFgJuEHwAJQApABUAIScQClMmKDBmMshlLzJTXgATdhgVAA4S53YAVX5eFgB5ZABZbFRMAFcEjJAWAE8mbHYxpBigA).

e.g.

* 10: https://www.digikey.co.nz/en/products/detail/lumimax-optoelectronic-technology/CF1-4W10RJTB/16710451
* 180: https://www.digikey.co.nz/en/products/detail/lumimax-optoelectronic-technology/CF1-4W180RJTB/16708329
* 270: https://www.digikey.co.nz/en/products/detail/lumimax-optoelectronic-technology/CF1-4W270RJTB/16708376
* 1K: https://www.digikey.co.nz/en/products/detail/lumimax-optoelectronic-technology/CF1-4W1KJTB/16708299
* 2K: https://www.digikey.co.nz/en/products/detail/lumimax-optoelectronic-technology/CF1-4W2K7JTB/16708187

Do you have any suggestions for how to automate this? Is there an example script I can use to generate [CSV or XLSX that can be imported into InvenTree](https://inventree.readthedocs.io/en/stable/settings/import/)?

issue.title: Automatically add "part stock" quantities to InvenTree when importing parts
issue.body:
Thanks for building this awesome tool! I was just wondering if there is a way to automatically add part stock as well? I'm trying to import lots of electronic components in my workshop, and it's a bit tedious that I have to create new stock items for every part. It would be useful if there was another field where I could choose the number of parts that I have and the stock location, and it creates the part stock entries with all these fields filled out: Supplier Part, Stock Location, and Quantity.

Is there already an option for this? If not, would you accept a PR?

issue.title: [FR] Is there a default library of electronic categories and parts that I could import?

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: This is an suggested enhancement or new feature

labels.name: triage:not-checked
labels.description: Item was not checked by the core team

issue.body:
### Please verify that this feature request has NOT been suggested before.

- [X] I checked and didn't find similar feature request

### Problem statement

I've just started trying out InvenTree to organize my home workshop and keep track of all my electronic components. I saw that InvenTree is installed as a blank slate and doesn't come with any options for predefined categories or parts. (As far as I'm aware.) This means that it will be quite tedious to set up lots of common categories for my electronic components.

I found the feature request issue for supplier integrations, and this sounds very interesting: https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/issues/3261

I'm in New Zealand, and I would be very interested in integrations with the following suppliers:

* Mouser electronics
* RS Components
* Element14
* Digi-Key
* Jaycar electronics
* Surplustronics
* Adafruit
* Sparkfun

In the meantime, it would be really helpful if I could import some basic categories for electronic components (e.g. resistors, LEDs, relays, switches.) Maybe also some common parts that can be ordered from any supplier (resistors, transisitors, diodes, push button switches, etc.) I don't want to start from scratch and add all these myself if someone already has a database that they could share.

### Suggested solution

Are there any database dumps that I could import, so that I could start with a basic list of categoriess and parts?

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Manually enter everything myself

### Examples of other systems

Not sure

### Do you want to develop this?

- [ ] I want to develop this.

comment.body: I found the [Ki-nTree integration](https://github.com/sparkmicro/Ki-nTree/). This provides [a really handy script that can set up lots of default categories](https://github.com/sparkmicro/Ki-nTree/#before-starting): `python3 -m kintree.setup_inventree`. That's awesome! I think it would be really useful if there was an option to use this default list of sub-categories when installing InvenTree, because it took me a little while to figure this out. I also got the Digikey API integration working, so I can import part numbers via their API: I'm really loving this software so far! Thanks to all the developers!

issue.title: Feature request: find/add parts using the octopart api
issue.body:
Hi,

I found this neat project on the Kicad forum and tried it instantly.
What holds me back from using it in a medium sized company is the part entry stuff.
It is a lot of manual work (even with the batch import/edit) and errors can be made. Also the price information can be old.

Octopart has a nice API: https://octopart.com/api/home
Adding a part would be much easier as all the information (including prices from multiple distributors, a picture and possibly Kicad library parts) can be fetched automatically. I'm starting to dream now but perhaps email notifications can be sent when stocks at distributors get low for instance.

comment.body:
If anyone else finds this comment - https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/issues/541#issuecomment-677961649

Here's the new link for the third-party InvenTree integrations page in the docs: https://inventree.readthedocs.io/en/latest/extend/plugins/

issue.title: [FR] Supplier integration

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: This is an suggested enhancement or new feature

labels.name: roadmap
labels.description: This is a roadmap feature with no immediate plans for implementation

issue.body:
**Problem**
There are a bunch of integrations for different vendors. Most implement the same logic.

**Suggested solution**
Create models and APIs to make integration easy. Create them in a way that TOSs are not borken.
- [x] Model + API for API keys and connections settings
- [ ] Model + API for requests + answers (+ cleanup)
- [x] Plugin mixin to enable easy search integration
- [ ] API + python integration to enable third parties proxied calls without keys on the system (or knowledge of them at all).

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
A lot of small implementations work right now.

**Do you want to develop this?**
Yes - I have some code that will be seriously reduced by that.


I really would like to get some feedback on this and maybe make a list of all vendors that should be considered:
- [ ] DigiKey
- [ ] Mouser
- [ ] SnapEDA #566
- [ ] OcotPartAPI #541
- [ ] LSCS https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/issues/677#issuecomment-612674739

comment.body:
Thanks for all your work on this @matmair, the supplier integration PR looks very exciting.

I was just wondering if this new feature will also be able to import part categories from suppliers? I opened a new issue since I wanted to see if there is a list of predefined categories and electronic components that I could start with, instead of starting with an empty database: https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/issues/3842

If anyone has been using InvenTree for a while, would you be willing to share a database backup that includes part categories? Thanks a lot!

issue.title: Add "send test email" feature for self-hosted installations
issue.body:
## Prerequisites
- [x] I have searched open and closed issues to make sure that the feature has not yet been requested.

## Feature request
Email reports on my self-hosted Plausible instance don't seem to be working, and I'm having some trouble debugging it: I can't find any Oban jobs from the `Plausible.Workers.SendEmailReports` module, and the functions that actually send the email are private in the workers. It'd be nice if there was some way to send a test email and display potential errors.

**How would you like it to work**
A button in the settings would let you send a test email to yourself (if your address has been verified). If any errors occur, they can be displayed in the front-end.

Alternatively, there could be a way to send such an email from the IEX console.

comment.body: Sorry to comment on an old thread, but I was also having email issues. Are the scheduled email reports still disabled by default? It looks like `CRON_ENABLED` is still set to `false` by default. I've used the password reset feature to confirm that emails are working (with Postmark), and I've just set `CRON_ENABLED=true`, so hopefully will see some email reports soon.

issue.title: Spelling mistake in the project name - Should be "ESPresence"
issue.body: Apologies if this has been brought up before, but I searched through the GitHub issues and didn't find anything for "typo" or "spelling". It's been bugging me for a little while that there's a spelling mistake in the project name. As far as I'm aware, I don't think "presense" is a valid spelling of the word "presence". #### https://wikidiff.com/presence/presense ---------- You can see how many times people have spelled it as "espresence" in the GitHub issues: https://github.com/ESPresense/ESPresense/issues?page=1&q=espresence ---------- Another point - lots of results for "presence" in the Home Assistant Core codebase: Zero results for "presense": So this can cause some confusion when setting up configuration for Home Assistant and MQTT. -------- `espresence.com` is unavailable, but I'd be happy to pay for `espresence.io` or `espresence.org`, or some other TLD. Perhaps this could be done for a version 3 major release. Please feel free to close this issue if you feel that it's too late to change the name or if it will be too much work. I just thought it needed to be opened!
